document.docAuthor: Liu, Tengteng, Wang, Shuxia & Li, Houhun
document.docTitle: Argyresthia (Argyresthia) surrecta Liu, Wang & Li, 2017, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Review of the genus Argyresthia Hübner, [1825] (Lepidoptera: Yponomeutoidea: Argyresthiidae) from China, with descriptions of forty-three new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of the genus Argyresthia Hübner, [1825] (Lepidoptera: Yponomeutoidea: Argyresthiidae) from China, with descriptions of forty-three new species

subSubSection.paragraph:
52.
Argyresthia ( Argyresthia ) surrecta
,
sp. nov.
( Figs. 64 , 130 , 186 , 242 , 288 , 300, 303 )

Male genitalia ( Figs. 130 , 186 , 242 ): Tuba analis shorter than width of valva. Socius with a process before middle on posterior margin, covered with one or two scale-like setae basally and two similar setae near apex, bearing two short setae apically; distal half covered with five to seven scale-like setae ( Fig. 242 ). Gnathos inflated distally, with three to four long thick setae apically. Valva oval, widest at middle; a row of long setae from base medially to distal area. Saccus longer than width of valva, with distal part narrowed, nearly linear. Phallus nearly straight, more sclerotized distally, about 8.0 times as long as width of valva ( Fig. 186 ). Second sternite with about nine micro-setae in each row; eighth sternite V or Y-shaped. Coremata present.

Female genitalia ( Fig. 288 ): Ovipositor 2.5 times as long as eighth segment. Anterior apophysis 2/3 length of posterior, bifurcate at middle; branch bifurcated a second time, with dorsal branch weakly extending to lamella postvaginalis, ventral branches fused, forming ventral margin of ostium bursae. Lamella postvaginalis triangular, concave anteriorly. Antrum funnel-shaped, half length of eighth segment. Ductus bursae spinulate from opening of ductus seminalis to corpus bursae; ductus seminalis originating from anterior 1/3 of ductus bursae. Corpus bursae ovate, narrower anteriorly, sometimes slightly concave medially, densely denticulated posteriorly; signum with basal plate short, rectangular, horns straight, extending outward horizontally, anterior margin straight.

DNA sequences
: Two COI barcodes were sequenced (one male and one female). The genetic distance is 0.3% between the two conspecifics, with interspecific genetic distances of 2.2̄2.6% between
A. ( A. ) surrecta
and
A. ( A. ) lanosa
,
sp. nov.
( Table 2 ).
Distribution. China ( Fujian , Guangxi , Guizhou , Henan , Hunan , Yunnan ).

Diagnosis. The diagnosis is given under
A. ( A. ) lanosa
,
sp. nov.

Etymology. The specific name is derived from the Latin surrectus , meaning nearly straight, referring to the nearly straight phallus as compared to the curved phallus of its congeners, A . ( A. ).
angusta
and
A . ( A .) lanosa
,
sp. nov.

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 2. Estimates of divergence (%) between COI sequences among specimens of
Argyresthia
. Uncorrected average pairwise distances are shown for the barcoding region. Analyses were conducted using the Kimura 2-parameter model. The rate variation among sites was modeled with a gamma distribution (shape parameter = 1). There were a total of 609 positions in the final dataset.
